article.headline: Butler 70, Wright St 62
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- Brandon Polk scored a game-high 19 points in Butler's 70-62 win over Wright State on Saturday at Hinkle Fieldhouse. The Bulldogs (11-8, 4-3 Horizon) never trailed in the game, but had to fend off a late second-half surge from Wright State. Avery Sheets' jumper gave Butler a 62-46 lead with 2:46 to play, but Butler converted just 2 of 5 free throws over the next 1:30 and committed three fouls that allowed the Raiders to score with the clock stopped. Dre Burleson hit a 3-pointer with one minute left to pull Wright State within 64-58, capping off a 12-2 run. Butler's A.J. Graves then made four free throws in the final minute and Brandon Crone and Sheets had one each to preserve the victory. Burleson and Jordan Pleiman each scored 18 for the Raiders (8-10, 4-4 Horizon). DaShaun Wood scored 12 and dished out six assists. Butler's victory broke a five-game losing streak to Wright State dating back to 2003, and was the Bulldogs' 88th win in their last 101 home games.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
